oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Grass endophytes in diet protect sibling voles from least weasel predation
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Saari, Susanna
Sundell, Janne
Huitu, Otso
Helander, Marjo
Ketoja, Elise
Ylönen, Hannu
Saikkonen, Kari
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this study, we first examined how feeding on Neotyphodium endophyte infected (E+) or endophyte free (E-) meadow ryegrass (Scherodonus pratensis) affects body mass and reproduction of sibling voles (Microtus levis), and then whether diet mediates the vulnerability of voles to least weasel (Mustela nivalis nivalis) predation.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Saari, Susanna; Sundell, Janne; Huitu, Otso; Helander, Marjo; Ketoja, Elise; Ylönen, Hannu and Saikkonen, Kari (2009) Grass endophytes in diet protect sibling voles from least weasel predation. Paper at: Ecology in a changing climate : the 10th international congress of ecology, Brisbane, Australia, 16-21 August 2009.
